item.author: piqeros

item.title: 【Helpdesk】[discussion] How do you feel about paying for filtered instrumentals/acapellas/stems?
item.description:
So I got into a bit of a youtube beef with a Russian in-my-view-scammer, who supposedly created his own AI filter, and proceeded to create a site where he charged people to download his REALLY crappy filtered instrumentals, acapellas & stems.

He would go as far as charge $40-50 USD for an instrumental album OR charge $20+ USD ongoing monthly subscription for merely a section (Instrumentals or Acapellas or Stems etc). He would upload anything and everything.

All it took to take that trash down is a well-worded email to the platform host informing them off the mass illegal profiteering being committed by that scamming Russki.

Now, I'm no hypocrite. I HAVE paid for material in the past, material I couldn't get anywhere else. But it was 100% legit from the studio, not some filtered trash like this.

I also create my own filtered content (instrumentals & acapellas). But I NEVER upload the raw filtered result! I use limiters and compressors & dynamic plugins to boost the overall sound & fill up those volume dips that remain behind where the vocals used to be. My subs love them, but I would never dream of charging them for a copy. That's just wrong.

Then I hear his inferior trash and it turns me into Gordon Ramsay.



On the other hand, there are sites like Splitter & Lalal that charge for premium splitting or minutes, but this was on a whole 'nother scale.

How do you feel about this?

PS: I will not be mentioning the name of this person or his site, so don't bother asking. His site has been taken down anyway.
item.author: KingOfHell1661
